description.narrative: Output 4.2: Child-sensitive and inclusive social protectionBy 2020, strengthened capacity to develop a child-sensitive and inclusive social protection policy framework and action plan to provide a comprehensive vision and commitment to the progressive realization of universal coverage of social protection., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection â€“ General, Economic And Social Policy General, Education â€“ General, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, improved equity-sensitive and child-friendly policies, programmes and budget allocations based on high-quality evidence and strengthened oversight

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2: Child-sensitive and inclusive social protectionBy 2020, strengthened capacity to develop a child-sensitive and inclusive social protection policy framework and action plan to provide a comprehensive vision and commitment to the progressive realization of universal coverage of social protection.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the finalization of the NDP III and UNSDCF documents to ensure Social Protection (SP) issues were embedded and comprehensive. UNICEF also responded well to the challenges imposed by the COVID-19 global pandemic, developing microsimulations and analyses leveraged by development partners to inform their SP response. Finally, UNICEF succeeded in ensuring the continuity of Social Protection programming and evidence generation through the KCCA GirlsEmpoweringGirls urban SP programme for adolescent girls when all other government-led SP programmes were paused, and the SIDA-funded Child - Sensitive Social Protection programme in West Nile. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide (Social protection and child poverty)

baseline.value: Level 1 System is fragmented with no functioning formal social protection coordination mechanisms at central level or local levels

target.value: 2018:Level 2: Social protection coordination mechanism is well functioning at the central level, and efforts are made towards the establishment at sub-national level

actual.value: 2018:Level 1: System is fragmented with no functioning formal social protection coordination mechanisms at central level or local levels

title.narrative: Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide

baseline.value: Score 1: System is fragmented with no functioning formal social protection coordination mechanisms at local level

target.value: 2020:Level 2 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at central and local level

title.narrative: M and E: Monitoring and evaluation mechanisms are used to follow up on social protection delivery/system

target.value: 2020:Score=2: Regular and predictable monitoring of the roadmap and main SP programmes
